actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to liberalize the earnings test, to provide that the remarriage of a beneficiary age 60 or over shall not terminate or reduce his or her benefit entitlement, to provide for the payment of a benefit to a qualified individual for the month of his or her death, and to eliminate the special dependency requirements for entitlement to husband's and widower's insurance benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Permits individuals receiving benefits under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to earn up to $3000 per year without any deductions from benefits. Provides that the remarriage of a beneficiary age 60 or over shall not terminate or reduce his or her benefit entitlement. Authorizes the payment benefits under title II of the Social Security Act to qualified individuals for the month of of death. Eliminates the special dependency requirements for entitlement to husband's and widower's insurance benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to liberalize the earnings test, to provide that the remarriage of a beneficiary age 60 or over shall not terminate or reduce his or her benefit entitlement, to provide for the payment of a benefit to a qualified individual for the month of his or her death, and to eliminate the special dependency requirements for entitlement to husband's and widower's insurance benefits.
